column5: When we were fishing for smallies one of the things we did with great success was trolling the shorelines and casting to shore with a couple split shot and a worm. Enough weight to cast but it would slowly sink. We are headed to Lac Seul in a couple weeks. Any of you ever just troll the shore and cast something simple like this? I would assume this could be effective for most anything. Walleye, Smallie and even Northern?

As a lad growing up, the annual family trip to LOW was usually spent slowly moving along the shore, and casting any number of artificials to "hit the spots". The movement was accomplished by rowing, an unheard of method in today's high tech world. Lots of fun and a great quiet way to enjoy. Bill
